history.content:
You could take an upper div technical elective in another department as part of the 7 unit requirement. There are a lot to choose from over the summer! 

https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/tech-electives

children.subject: I am already enrolled to complete my upper div technicals in the fall :/

I guess I'm just really frustrated because if I had known that the class had even the smallest chance of getting cancelled, I would have put myself in other classes to save my spot. This came out of nowhere and summer is approaching very quickly. I really hope the university can do something to alleviate the situation because my entire academic plan is up in the air right now.

history.content:
If this is directed at staff, please see @5046

You're right, this wasn't in staff control

I enrolled for EE16A trying to knock out a CS graduation requirement. Since it was cancelled so close to summer enrollment, all the other classes I would have taken are full. For example, my other alternative to taking EE16A was taking CS160. I tried to enroll and I am 47 on the waitlist and the class only has 62 students. I would have been able to take this alternative if we were notified earlier. I realize it was probably not in anyone's control but the this put me in a really difficult situation. Is there anything anyone can do to get me into another class? I would really like to graduate on time.

Has anyone else had experience with getting enrolled into a class due to extenuating circumstances or university error?
history.subject: EE16A cancelled. Other summer CS classes are full.
